definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Perhaps this concealment, this disguise, was beneath me.
sentences.chinese: 我這樣隱瞞，這樣欺矇，也許失掉了我自己的身份。

sentences.english: One false move and you will lose their respect and admiration forever. Here are some general rules
sentences.chinese: 一着不慎，你就可能永遠失掉他們的尊敬和崇拜。

sentences.english: If he does not lose the heart of the people, his virtues will flourish.
sentences.chinese: 君主不失掉人心，德政就能傳播四萬。

sentences.english: To lose a freind is the greatest of all loses.
sentences.chinese: 失掉朋儕是一切損失中最大的損失。

sentences.english: Even Reading, that point could be the one that wins us the title.
sentences.chinese: 對雷丁失掉的分數有可能就能幫助我們奪下冠軍。

sentences.english: You deserve true happiness, and Ihope that you will find it soon.
sentences.chinese: 你理應失掉真正的幸福，我希望你能很快找到。

sentences.english: I really mourn the loss of that gold watch.
sentences.chinese: 我真爲失掉那塊金錶惋惜。

sentences.english: How have you managed to stay focused and motivated for more than eight years?
sentences.chinese: 你是如何讓自己8年多來不失掉這種動機？

sentences.english: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
sentences.chinese: 有些事件得相信了纔看失掉。

sentences.english: Jumping into water is the only respite.
sentences.chinese: 跳進水內只能失掉暫時的緩解。

sentences.english: In Britain women were enfranchised in 1918.
sentences.chinese: 1918年英國婦女失掉議會選舉權。

sentences.english: What if he had not produced a double fault to lose the third set tiebreak?
sentences.chinese: 如果他沒有在搶七中雙發失誤而失掉第三盤？

sentences.english: The wicket-keeper fumbled the ball and dropped it.
sentences.chinese: 那個守門員居然笨手笨腳地脫手失掉了球。

sentences.english: And I can't make an entire life disappear to start a new one.
sentences.chinese: 我不能讓這一生都消失掉去重新來過。

sentences.english: Unlike stretch marks, the spiders will disappear after delivery.
sentences.chinese: 不像擴展標記，在分娩之後，這些痣會消失掉。

sentences.english: I would rather lose a dozen cherry trees than you should tell one lie.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願失掉一打櫻桃樹而不願聽到你撒一次謊。

definition: to be used up/to be exhausted
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to go up in smoke/to vanish
to completely lose (one's dignity, vitality etc)
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
